body: After further debugging, I see that EncryptionMethod.ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG is used for unzipping only, so maybe the exception message can be more meaningful, ie "ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG not supported for encryption".

issue.title: unzip failed

repository.name: zip4j
repository.description: A Java library for zip files and streams

body:
> After further debugging, I see that EncryptionMethod.ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG is used for unzipping only, 

Actually, `ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG` is neither supported for encryption nor for decryption. This is a proprietary encryption method by PKWare and using this encryption technology needs license from them. The only reason I had it as an enum is that this field is defined in the zip specification.
I appreciate the PR, but unfortunately, I cannot accept the PR as it might mislead the users that unzipping using `ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG` is supported, which is not the case.

I appreciate your response. You can use the same message for decryption too. My issue was that the exception message is misleading: using an ecryption method offered by the library is labeled as invalid (not supported is something else).
I pushed a commit with a small change to your exception message because of the reason mentioned above. I will close your PR, but thanks again for your PR.

issue.title: Issue256: Meaningful exception message

repository.name: zip4j
repository.description: A Java library for zip files and streams

issue.body: Issue256: Meaningful exception message when using EncryptionMethod.ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG for encryption

body: Fixed in v2.7.0 which was released today.

issue.title: Bump zip4j from 1.3.2 to 2.7.0

labels.name: type:dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency

repository.name: allure-maven
repository.description: Maven plugin generating Allure report from test results

issue.body:
Bumps [zip4j](https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j) from 1.3.2 to 2.7.0.
Release notes

Sourced from zip4j's releases.

v2.7.0

New Features:

  • #216 Set buffer size from ZipFile
  • #278 Option to skip extracting symlinks when extracting zip files

Improvements:

  • #256 Improve message in exception for EncryptionMethod.ZIP_STANDARD_VARIANT_STRONG
  • #266 Change default unix permissions to 644

Bugs:

  • #259 Fix bug when charset is explicitly set to utf-8
  • #263 ZipFile can be constructed with a null File causing NPE some time later
  • #268 File attributes of zipped folders are not applied on extraction
  • #274 Consider external file attributes as well to set directory flag
  • #279 Skip reading until end of entry only for files when data descriptor is set
  • #282 Convert password to utf-8 before encrypting
  • #284 Improve password verification for Zip Standard decryption

v2.6.4

Improvements:

#239 Check if file exists before adding the file to zip #249 Bump junit from 4.12 to 4.13.1 #250 Use Collections.sort instead of List.sort for older Android version compatibility

Bug fixes:

#246 Can't create big archive when zipFile reference not reinitialized

v2.6.3

Improvements:

#241 Switch to SecureRandom for encryption randomness

v2.6.2

Improvements:

  • #202 Validity check for missing split z* files
  • #214 Add a utility method to get the epoch time of the entries
  • #200 #209 #210 #211 #212 #222 Improve README

Bug:

  • #204 Thread for unzipping does not exit when run in another thread
  • #220 Fix entry deletion issue when central directory entries are in different order than local entries
  • #228 Handle Strong encryption with proper error message
  • #231 Missing unix permissions when adding file via stream

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
